item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Monday, January 20, 2025 at 2:45 AM UTC
item.description:
1. It's time to make computing personal again (232 points | 72 comments)
2. TikTok says it is restoring service for U.S. users (512 points | 1550 comments)
3. Chopstick sleeves as emissaries of Japanese typography and culture (46 points | 3 comments)
4. FrontierMath was funded by OpenAI (218 points | 58 comments)

6. F-Droid Security Issues (10 points | 4 comments)
7. JTAG 'Hacking' the Original Xbox in 2023 (33 points | 3 comments)

10. How do interruptions impact different software engineering activities (30 points | 1 comment)
11. Using your Apple device as an access card in unsupported systems (159 points | 61 comments)

13. Two Hard Things (2009) (12 points | 2 comments)
14. The surprising struggle to get a Unix Epoch time from a UTC string in C or C++ (87 points | 39 comments)

23. Forgejo: A self-hosted lightweight software forge (352 points | 248 comments)

25. Gauntlet AI (YC S17) is training AI engineers and hiring them in Austin ( | hide)
26. A generative model for inorganic materials design (32 points | 3 comments)
27. GitHub introduces sub-issues, issue types and advanced search (330 points | 189 comments)
28. Escape the walled garden and algorithm black boxes with RSS feeds (238 points | 85 comments)
29. Haskell: A Great Procedural Language (229 points | 170 comments)
30. How hard would it be to display the contents of an image file on the screen? (160 points | 64 comments)
